comment:
As a man who was involved in a relationship with a wildly violent woman, and then accused of being the abuser, I empathize with Johnny Depp 110%.  I was left bleeding and unconscious on the bedroom floor, only to be arrested the next day for domestic assault.  This was back in the '90s, before the "METOO" movement, and "believe all women", but I got railroaded through the court system just the same, and had to serve a year of probation (and pay a small fortune) for a crime that I was the VICTIM of, not the PERPETRATOR.  I wasn't even given the opportunity to face my accuser and testify on my own behalf.  I was automatically branded guilty of a laundry-list of fabricated offenses with absolutely ZERO evidence... because I'm a man...  and it's IMPOSSIBLE for a man to be abused by a woman in the eyes of the law.  What's worse, is that I was told that this was going to happen, BY MY OWN WORTHLESS LAWYER, before I ever set foot in a courtroom!

The worst part is having to explain to your friends, family, co-workers, etc., what happened.  They either don't believe you (and you can TELL when they don't believe you), and automatically regard you as a scumbag wife beater, or if they DO believe you, they think of you as less than a man for allowing yourself to be abused by a woman.  There's no middle ground.  It's a catch-22...  You can't win.

Sign the petition!

comment: Ms Heard SOLD "evidence" to tabloids for profit. She refused to submit her evidence to the courts for testing and verification--preferring to DROP the domestic abuse case. This occurred BEFORE the divorce. The Judge dismissed the case WITH PREJUDICE (Ms heard can never bring charges of abuse against Mr Depp again), an extraordinary circumstance that indicates a fundamental flaw in the case, usually the evidence. Mr Depp has waited silently until Ms Heard presented him with a LEGAL opportunity to present HIS evidence in court, and clear his name. Ms Heard now has no choice but to submit her "faulty evidence" to the court for testing and verification. When the discrepancies are discovered, laws will have been broken. Evidence tampering, and evidence fabrication are serious, but when the perpetrator has benefited financially, and attempted to use such evidence to extort someone, as well as destroy someone's career and promote themselves--we are looking at jail time. I can't see any way out for Ms Heard, unless she turns on her two accomplices, iO Tillet Wright, and Raquel Pennington. Unless she can persuade the court that these two women somehow coerced her into framing Mr Depp, I'm afraid it is back to jail for Ms Heard. You can't star in any movies when incarcerated.

comment:
So I'm unclear did she want to never speak to depp or was she telling him to speak to her - as I can't tell if she's telling him not to knock on her door, or specifically asking him to.

Also just to be fair, didn't one of Depp's previous relationships say he was a nasty drunk ?
And just because she's a sociopath doesn't preclude Depp also being a piece of work, unless she says he's blameless. Unfortunately the behavior or a legit 1 sided abuser and the behaviour of a warring couple is much alike - as the abuser will blame the other person and so would someone if both of them were nasty to each other. It does seem a lot more likely to me though that if they couldn't stand each other one or the other would leave a lot quicker - it requires i'd think one or both of them to be making excuses about the other's behavior, as for the finger thing ; well I'd say there is a difference between someone smashing a bottle then stabbing someone with it and someone hitting someone when they have an intact bottle in their hand - not expecting it to shatter. But I can think of instances were people have shattered a bottle or glass on someones head or face so I guess it could have been a horizontal swipe with intention to shatter the hand or the glass - where as slamming a bottle down on someone's hand with the intention of warding them off and having it break isn't quite as bad as it's somewhat defensive - I think the context on that is hard to tell. If does look bad though.

I don't know enough about her character to really judge or his for that matter - for all we know she might have a string of abused partners and injured victims to her name and Depp is completely blameless or they might both be volatile personalities who just wind each other up to the point of violence. It does seems like it's still to early to tell.

But I'm sure I read someone somewhere saying they'd never work with depp again (and I can't recall who that was and when but it was a very long time ago - so maybe Depp had a rep before he ever met this woman). I really do not know enough about the guy to be able to say though.

comment:
Would be interesting to see what would happen if this actually happens. 
We have seen women cry over being put on the sex offender list and write articles about how much it ruined their lives to be put on it. 
We have seen women cry over 50/50 Child custody, crying in an article explaining how unfair it was and how it ruined their lives, that the father got equal custody over his children. 
So if cancel culture actually hit Amber Heard and she starts crying over it, it will be interesting to see how many articles will come out taking her side, decrying the evil of cancel culture when it hits them.
